required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase III Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Entecavir in Pediatric Patients With Chronic Hepatitis B Virus Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study of the Antiviral Efficacy and Safety of Entecavir (ETV) Versus Placebo in Pediatric Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) Infection Who Are HBeAg-Positive

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of entecavir in pediatric patients with chronic hepatitis B virus infection

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Combination of Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA Suppression and Hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) Seroconversion at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: Suppression=HBV DNA<50 IU/mL (approximately 300 copies/mL) using the Roche COBAS TaqMan HBV Test for use with the High Pure System assay; seroconversion=undetectable HBeAg and detectable anti-hepatitis B e antibodies. While the analysis of the primary endpoint was based on a randomized sample size of 123 participants (the Primary Cohort), the size of the overall study population was augmented to 180 randomized participants to meet global regulatory requirements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) DNA <50 IU/mL at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: While the analysis of the primary endpoint was based on a randomized sample size of 123 participants (the Primary Cohort), the size of the overall study population was augmented to 180 randomized participants to meet global regulatory requirements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Serum Alanine Aminotransferase â‰¤1*Upper Limit of Normal at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: While the analysis of the primary endpoint was based on a randomized sample size of 123 participants (the Primary Cohort), the size of the overall study population was augmented to 180 randomized participants to meet global regulatory requirements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B Virus DNA <Limit of Quantitation (LOQ) at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: LOQ=29 IU/mL. While the analysis of the primary endpoint was based on a randomized sample size of 123 participants (the Primary Cohort), the size of the overall study population was augmented to 180 randomized participants to meet global regulatory requirements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) Seroconversion at Week 48 (Undetectable HBeAg and Presence of Anti-HBeAb)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants in the primary cohort with HBeAg seroconversion (undetectable HBeAg and presence of anti-HBe antibodies) at week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Sustained HBeAg Seroconversion During Off-treatment Follow up Among Participants Who Achieved HBeAg Seroconversion at End of Dosing (EOD).
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who demonstrated HBeAg seroconversion at EOD were followed and assessed for presence of sustained HBeAg seroconversion during entire study. The study reached the end of dosing (EOD) on 22 Feb-2016.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (Including Palatability Issues), SAEs, Discontinuous Due to Adverse Events, and HBV Disease Progression Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through Week 48 on blinded therapy
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Related=having certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death. ALT=alanine aminotransferase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Test Results Meeting the Criteria for Abnormality (Grades 1-4)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through Week 48 on blinded therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Toxicities graded per Division of AIDS criteria, Version 1.0, and modified World Health Organization criteria. INR=international normalization ratio of prothrombin time; ULN=upper limit of normal. Hemoglobin (g/dL): Grade 1=10-10.9; Grade 2=9-9.9; Grade 3=7-8.9; Grade 4= <7. Platelets (/mm^3): Grade 1=100,000-124,999; Grade 2=50,000-99,999; Grade 3=25,000-49,999; Grade 4= <25,000. INR (*ULN): Grade 1=1.1-1.5; Grade 2=1.6-2; Grade 3=2.1-3; Grade 4= >3. WBC (/mm^3): Grade 1=2000-2500; Grade 2=1500-1999; Grade 3=1000-1499; Grade 4= <1000. Neutrophils (/mm^3): Grade 1=1000-1300; Grade 2=750-999; Grade 3=500-749; Grade 4= <500.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Test Results Meeting the Criteria for Abnormality (Grades 1-4) (Continued)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through Week 48 on blinded therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Toxicities graded per Division of AIDS criteria, Version 1.0, and modified World Health Organization criteria. ALT=alanine aminotransferase; AST=aspartate aminotransferase; BUN=blood urea nitrogen; ULN=upper limit of normal; LLN=lower limit of normal. ALT, AST (*ULN): Grade 1=1.25-2; Grade 2=2.6-5; Grade 3=5.1-10; Grade 4 => 10. Bilirubin (*ULN): Grade 1 = 1.1-1.5; Grade 2=1.6-2.5; Grade 3 = 2.6-5; Grade 4= >5. Albumin (g/dL): Grade 1=3- <LLN; Grade 2=2-2.9; Grade 3= <2. Lipase (*ULN): Grade 1=1.1-1.5; Grade 2=1.6-3; Grade 3=3.1-5; Grade 4= >5. BUN/urea (*ULN): Grade 1=1.25-<2.6; Grade 2=2.6-<5.1; Grade 3=5.1-10; Grade 4= >10. Chloride, high (mEq/L): Grade 1=113-<117; Grade 2=117-<121; Grade 3=121-125; Grade 4= >125. Potassium, low (mEq/L): Grade 1=3-3.4; Grade 2=2.5-<3; Grade 3=2-<2.5; Grade 4=<2. Potassium, high (mEq/L): : Grade 1= 5.6-<6.1; Grade 2=6.1-<6.6; Grade 3=6.6-7; Grade 4= >7. Sodium, high (mEq/L): Grade 1=146<151; Grade 2=151-<155; Grade 3=155-<160; Grade 4= >=160.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HBeAg Seroconversion on ETV Over-time at Week 96 (All ETV Cohort)
secondary_outcome.description: HBe seroconversion=undetectable HBe antigen and detectable anti-HBe antibodies. While the analysis of the primary endpoint was based on a randomized sample size of 123 participants (the Primary Cohort), the size of the overall study population was augmented to 180 randomized participants to meet global regulatory requirements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Maintained HBeAg Seroconversion at Week 96 (End of Blinded Therapy) Among Participants With HBeAg Seroconversion at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who achieved HBeAg seroconversion by Week 48 and maintained seroconversion to week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Related AEs, Grade 2-4 Related AEs, Grade 3-4 AEs, Malignancies, ALT Flares, and Hepatic Disease Progression Through Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Related=having certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death. ALT=alanine aminotransferase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HBeAg Seroconversion (Undetectable HBeAg and Presence of Anti-HBeAb) up to Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: On Treatment through week 96 - 2 year cohort NC = F: (The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on treated participants. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were considered failures.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Histological Analysis (Percentage) Among Participants With Available Liver Biopsy Data
secondary_outcome.description: Liver function test elevations and abnormalities on blinded and open-label ETV (the All ETV Safety Cohort). Participants who experienced elevation of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than three times ETV (entecavir) baseline measure (Participants who displayed liver biopsy with ALT value greater than three times baseline.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HbeAg Loss at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBeAg Loss (NC = F and NC = M) - On Treatment through Week 96 - Year 2 Efficacy Cohort Non-Completer - Failure (NC=F): The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on treated participants. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were considered failures. Non-Completer - Missing (NC=M): The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on participants with data at the analysis week. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were excluded.

arm_group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.015 mg/kg up to 0.5 mg, once daily, for 96 to 144 weeks, depending on response
Participants received placebo, 0 mg, once daily, for 48 to 96 weeks, depending on response

intervention.description: Tablets/oral solution, 0.015 mg/kg up to 0.5 mg, administered orally, once daily, for 96 to144 weeks, depending on response
Tablets/oral solution, 0 mg, administered orally, once daily, for 48 to 96 weeks, depending on response

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria
- Males and females, aged 2 to <18 years
- Hepatitis B surface antigen-positive
- Detectable hepatitis B e (HBe) antigen, and no detectable anti-HBe antibodies
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) 1.5 to <10 times the upper limit of normal at screening and within 8 to 24 weeks prior to screening
- Evidence of the presence of hepatitis B virus DNA at least 4 weeks before screening and >100,000 copies/mL at screening
Key Exclusion Criteria
- Any prior therapy with entecavir
- At least 12 weeks of prior therapy with any nucleoside or nucleotide antiviral agent
- Therapy with interferon alpha, thymosin alpha, or nucleototide antiviral agents within 24 weeks of screening
- Coinfection with HIV, hepatitis C virus, or hepatitis D virus
- Decompensated liver disease
- Liver transplant recipients
- Other forms of acute and chronic conditions which may cause increased ALT levels
- Children who were breastfed while their mothers received lamivudine or whose mothers received lamivudine during pregnancy

facility.name: Indiana University School Of Medicine / Riley Hospital
Levine Children'S Hospital At Carolinas Medical Center

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 228 patients enrolled, 43 no longer met study criteria, 4 withdrew consent, and 1 withdrew for surgery. While the primary endpoint analysis was based on a randomized sample size of 123 participants, the overall study population was augmented to 180 to meet global regulatory requirements. All 180 randomized patients received study drug.

measure.description: Participants who achieved HBeAg seroconversion by Week 48 and maintained seroconversion to week 96
measure.population: participants with HBeAg seroconversion at Week 48

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Related AEs, Grade 2-4 Related AEs, Grade 3-4 AEs, Malignancies, ALT Flares, and Hepatic Disease Progression Through Week 96
outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Related=having certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death. ALT=alanine aminotransferase.

group.title: Blinded and Open-Label (All ETV)
group.description: All ETV group during long-term follow-up that show increased ALT (alanine aminotransferase)

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Related AEs, Grade 2-4 Related AEs, Grade 3-4 AEs, Malignancies, ALT Flares, and Hepatic Disease Progression Through Week 96
measure.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Related=having certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death. ALT=alanine aminotransferase.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With HBeAg Seroconversion (Undetectable HBeAg and Presence of Anti-HBeAb) up to Week 96
outcome.description: On Treatment through week 96 - 2 year cohort NC = F: (The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on treated participants. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were considered failures.)
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Entecavir
group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.015 mg/kg up to 0.5 mg, once daily, for 96 to 144 weeks, depending on response.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With HBeAg Seroconversion (Undetectable HBeAg and Presence of Anti-HBeAb) up to Week 96
measure.description: On Treatment through week 96 - 2 year cohort NC = F: (The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on treated participants. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were considered failures.)
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Histological Analysis (Percentage) Among Participants With Available Liver Biopsy Data
outcome.description: Liver function test elevations and abnormalities on blinded and open-label ETV (the All ETV Safety Cohort). Participants who experienced elevation of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than three times ETV (entecavir) baseline measure (Participants who displayed liver biopsy with ALT value greater than three times baseline.)
outcome.population: Randomized ETV subjects combined with PBO-randomized participants who received open-label ETV

group.title: Blinded and Open-Label (All ETV)
group.description: All ETV group during long-term follow-up that show increased ALT (alanine aminotransferase)

measure.title: Histological Analysis (Percentage) Among Participants With Available Liver Biopsy Data
measure.description: Liver function test elevations and abnormalities on blinded and open-label ETV (the All ETV Safety Cohort). Participants who experienced elevation of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than three times ETV (entecavir) baseline measure (Participants who displayed liver biopsy with ALT value greater than three times baseline.)
measure.population: Randomized ETV subjects combined with PBO-randomized participants who received open-label ETV

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With HbeAg Loss at Weeks 48 and 96
outcome.description: HBeAg Loss (NC = F and NC = M) - On Treatment through Week 96 - Year 2 Efficacy Cohort Non-Completer - Failure (NC=F): The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on treated participants. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were considered failures. Non-Completer - Missing (NC=M): The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on participants with data at the analysis week. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were excluded.
outcome.population: Participants with response rates at weeks 48 and 96 in Entecavir (ETV) and Placebo (PBO) randomized cohort

group.title: Entecavir
group.description: Participants received entecavir, 0.015 mg/kg up to 0.5 mg, once daily, for 96 to 144 weeks, depending on response.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo, 0 mg, once daily, for 48 to 96 weeks, depending on response

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With HbeAg Loss at Weeks 48 and 96
measure.description: HBeAg Loss (NC = F and NC = M) - On Treatment through Week 96 - Year 2 Efficacy Cohort Non-Completer - Failure (NC=F): The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on treated participants. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were considered failures. Non-Completer - Missing (NC=M): The numerator was based on participants meeting the response criteria. The denominator was based on participants with data at the analysis week. Participants who had missing data at the analysis week were excluded.
measure.population: Participants with response rates at weeks 48 and 96 in Entecavir (ETV) and Placebo (PBO) randomized cohort

reported_events.time_frame: All non-serious adverse events were collected from start of study treatment through Week 48, while all serious adverse events were evaluated through out the study (5 years).

group.title: ETV (Entecavir)
group.description: Subjects received 0.015 milligram per kilogram per day (mg/kg/day) (up to a maximum dose of 0.5 mg/day) ETV as oral solution or tablets, once daily (QD).

group.title: PLACEBO
group.description: Subjects received ETV matched placebo as oral solution or tablets, QD.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period â‰¤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
